basics.name: Tanmay Agrawal
basics.label: PhD in Applied Mechanics
basics.summary: PhD in Applied Mechanics from IIT Delhi specializing in experimental and computational fluid dynamics, with a focus on fluid transport, air curtains, and gravity currents.

work.name: Indian Institute of Technology Delhi
work.summary: Assisted teaching fluid mechanics (UG & PG), computational fluid dynamics (PG), environmental fluid mechanics (PG) & Engineering mechanics (UG).

work.name: The University of Melbourne
work.summary: Conducted workshops and laboratory sessions for the courses on civil hydraulics (PG), fluid mechanics (UG).

work.name: National Tsing Hua University
work.summary: Graduate teaching assistant for the course on gas dynamics (UG). Conducted tutorials and graded assignments and exams.

work.name: National Tsing Hua University
work.summary: Worked as an intern at the computational fluid dynamics laboratory. Developed two-dimensional parallel solvers based on lattice Boltzmann method using CUDA-C to simulate incompressible fluid flows on graphic processing unit (GPU).
highlights: Validated solver with lid-driven cavity flow
Extended solver for flow over a cylinder using immersed boundary method (IBM)

volunteer.organization: Mechanical Engineering Research Student Association (MERSA), The University of Melbourne
volunteer.summary: In-charge for organization of multiple academic and fun events such as technical workshops, outdoor trips etc. to enhance interaction between various research groups.
Participated in many running events (individual and relay) with distances varying from 1 mile to 105 KM. Assisted as pacer in many 5K and 10K races.
Teaching on the online platform, primarily in the field of thermofluids and design, and having a student base of more than 14,500.

awards.title: Research Excellent Travel Award
awards.summary: Monetary assistance (INR 2,00,000) provided to selected PhD students in the institute towards presenting in an international conference.

awards.title: Prime Minister Research Fellowship
awards.summary: Highly competitive PhD fellowship that includes a research grant (INR 2,00,000 per year) followed by a rigorous annual review. (2022-2024)

awards.title: SERB International Travel Support
awards.summary: Financial assistance (INR 1,75,000) towards attending summer school at University of Cambridge, UK.

awards.title: Melbourne Postgraduate Research Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship for meritorious international students to pursue a research degree. (2017-2020)

awards.title: NTHU International Student Scholarship
awards.summary: Fully-funded postgraduate scholarship to undertake a master degree. (2014-2016)

publications.name: Performance and flow dynamics of heavy air curtains using experiments and numerical simulations
publications.summary: Authors: Tanmay Agrawal, Shresth Agarwal, Vamsi K. Chalamalla and Narsing K. Jha

publications.name: Numerical investigation of air curtain flows in the doorway of a building using RANS and LES
publications.summary: Authors: Tanmay Agrawal, Narsing K. Jha and Vamsi K. Chalamalla

publications.name: Dynamics of a buoyant gravity current propagating in a linearly stratified medium
publications.summary: Authors: Tanmay Agrawal, Siva Heramb Peddada and Vamsi K. Chalamalla

publications.name: Probing the high mixing efficiency events in a lock-exchange flow through simultaneous velocity and temperature measurements
publications.summary: Authors: Tanmay Agrawal, Bhaarath Ramesh, Spencer J Zimmerman, Jimmy Philip and Joseph C Klewicki. (Selected as Editor's Picks)

publications.name: A parallel nonlinear multigrid solver for unsteady incompressible flow simulation on multi-GPU cluster
publications.summary: Authors: Xiaolei Shi, Tanmay Agrawal, Chao-An Lin, Feng-Nan Hwang and Tzu-Hsuan Chiu

publications.name: Solar Absorption Refrigeration System for Air-Conditioning of a Classroom Building in Northern India
publications.publisher: Journal of The Institution of Engineers: Series C
publications.summary: Authors: Tanmay Agrawal, Varun and Anoop Kumar

publications.name: On the equivalence of top and bottom gravity currents in a linearly stratified channel
publications.summary: Accepted for publication by AGU Books in the monograph series focussed on Particulate Gravity Currents. Authors: Tanmay Agrawal, Marius Ungarish and Vamsi K. Chalamalla
